# Introduction

The Clearinghouse for Financing Development Data is an innovative platform designed to connect countries, donors, and development agencies in their efforts to strengthen data and statistical systems. By matching the supply and demand of financing for data and statistics, the Clearinghouse promotes transparency, accountability, and alignment while fostering better coordination among donors and partner countries. 

Through its tools and services, the Clearinghouse enables donors to identify key data funding gaps in recipient countries, benchmark their own contributions, and explore opportunities for collaboration with other donors. Recipient countries, in turn, can use the platform to assess how much aid they receive for statistical capacity, identify remaining funding gaps, plan future investments, and advocate for additional support from governments and donors. Beyond these core users, researchers and civil society organisations can draw on the Clearinghouseâ€™s resources to analyse broader trends in data financing and identify major donors and recipients in the field. 

An initiative of the Bern Network on Financing Data for Development the Clearinghouse focuses particularly on low- and lower-middle-income countries as well as fragile states. It aims to improve the identification of needs, strengthen investment proposals, enhance coordination at the country level, and bridge domestic and external financial and technical support to bolster data systems in low-capacity settings.
